meanings.definition: Relating to or being a prototype.
meanings.sent1: The prototypal design was used as a model for the final product.
meanings.sent2: The company created a prototypal version of the new software.
meanings.sent3: The prototypal blueprint made the engineers chuckle with its simplicity.
meanings.sent4: Her prototypal approach to problem-solving was both innovative and effective.
meanings.sent5: The prototypal model served as a clear example for the team to follow.

meanings.sent1: The prototypal device was the first of its kind in the market.
meanings.sent2: The team used a prototypal model to test the new features.
meanings.sent3: His prototypal attempt at baking a cake ended in a messy kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The prototypal car showcased futuristic technology ahead of its time.
meanings.sent5: The prototypal product set the standard for quality in the industry.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or being an early, typical, or ancestral form.
meanings.sent1: The prototypal species displayed characteristics of its ancient ancestors.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed artifacts from the prototypal era of civilization.
meanings.sent3: The prototypal fashion trend from the past made a surprising comeback.
meanings.sent4: Her prototypal hairstyle was inspired by historical figures.
meanings.sent5: The prototypal language used by the tribe was a link to their heritage.
